title: Interprofessional Clinical Foundations I
description: The first course in a four-part series that covers interprofessional patient communication, medical interviewing, physical examination, and health promotion. Direct instruction in professionalism, diversity, social determinants of health, kindness, mindfulness, well-being, epidemiology, and biostatistics.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Interprofessional Clinical Foundations II
description: The second course in four-part series that covers interprofessional communication, medical interviewing, physical examination, and health promotion. Direct instruction in professionalism, diversity, social determinants of health, kindness, mindfulness, well-being, epidemiology, and biostatistics.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Interprofessional Clinical Foundations III
description: The third course in a four-part series that covers interprofessional communication, medical interviewing, physical examination, and health promotion. Direct instruction in professionalism, diversity, social determinants of health, kindness, mindfulness, well-being, epidemiology, and biostatistics.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Interprofessional Clinical Foundations IV
description: The fourth course in a four-part series that covers interprofessional communication, medical interviewing, physical examination, and health promotion. Direct instruction in professionalism, diversity, social determinants of health, kindness, mindfulness, well-being, epidemiology, and biostatistics.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacy Practice I
description: The first of a four-part series that covers the function and role of the health care team, Pharmacist Patient Care Process, immunization certification, communication and documentation, informatics, patient safety, interviewing, active listening, management/leadership, careers, resiliency, and student wellness.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacy Practice II
description: The second of a four-part series that covers the function and roles of the health care team, Pharmacist Patient Care Process, immunization certification, communication and documentation, informatics, patient safety, interviewing, active listening, management/leadership, careers, resiliency, and student wellness.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacy Practice III
description: The third of a four-part series that covers the function and role of the health care team, Pharmacist Patient Care Process, immunization certification, communication and documentation, informatics, patient safety, interviewing, active listening, management/leadership, careers, resiliency, and student wellness.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacy Practice IV
description: The fourth of a four-part series that covers the function and role of the health care team, Pharmacist Patient Care Process, immunization certification, communication and documentation, informatics, patient safety, interviewing, active listening, management/leadership, careers, resiliency, and student wellness.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Self Care I: Conventional and Complementary
description: Educates pharmacy students about healthy lifestyle choices, the importance of mental and physical health, and self-care. Provides students with methods and techniques for dealing with the stressors of a professional educational environment and life challenges.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Self Care II: Conventional and Complementary
description: The study of nonprescription products, complementary/alternative medicine, and non-pharmacological interventions for select self-treatable medical conditions commonly encountered by the pharmacist. Emphasis on the pharmacist's consultant role in product selection and non-pharmacological recommendations.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Self Care III: Conventional and Complementary
description: Relates to patients' ability to care for themselves with emphasis on the pharmacist's consultant role and continues to explore self-treatable medical conditions commonly encountered by pharmacists, including non-pharmacologic interventions, nonprescription medications, and complementary/alternative products to treat them.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy Principles to Practice I: Central Nervous System
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers the central nervous system.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy Principles to Practice II: Immunology
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers the immune system.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice III: Cardiovascular and Respiratory Systems
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers the cardiovascular and respiratory systems.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice IV: Endocrine System
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers the endocrine system.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice V: Gastrointestinal System, Dermatologic, and Opthalmologic Disorders
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers gastrointestinal, dermatologic, and opthalmologic disorders.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice VI: Infectious Diseases
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers gastrointestinal, dermatologic, and opthalmologic disorders.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice VII: Hematology and Oncologic Disorders
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers hematology and oncologic disorders.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacotherapy - Principles to Practice VIII: Special Population and Nutritional Disorders
description: Integrates principles of biomedical and pharmaceutical sciences with evidence-based traditional and non-traditional therapies for management and prevention of disease. Topics include clinical chemistry, clinical toxicology, interprofessional health care, and public health. Covers special population and nutritional disorders.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Information Analytics and Numeracy I: Biostatistics
description: Exposure to basic statistics and techniques that are commonly found in the medical and pharmacy literature, covering descriptive and inferential statistics. Students learn to choose the most appropriate statistical parametric and non-parametric tests and interpret findings from the literature.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Information Analytics and Numeracy II: Drug Information, Research Methods, and Literature Analysis
description: Addresses development of knowledge, skills, and attitudes required for biomedical inquiry and discovery, including methods for data retrieval, analysis, interpretation, and synthesis.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Information Analytics and Numeracy III: Epidemiology
description: Covers distribution of disease and health in groups of people and the factors that influence the distribution, including evaluation of therapeutic and diagnostic treatments and delivery of health care services.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Molecular Basis of Health and Disease I: Microbiology and Immunology
description: Principles of medical microbiology, immunology, virology, and parasitology.  Introduction to classification, morphology, and physiology of microorganisms, particularly those that cause human pathology - bacteria, viruses, fungi, protozoans, parasite, and worms - and the body's immune response.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Molecular Basis of Health and Disease II: Microbiology and Immunology
description: Principles of medical microbiology, immunology, virology, and parasitology. Introduction to classification, morphology, and physiology of microorganisms, particularly those that cause human pathology - bacteria, viruses, fungi, protozoans, parasite, and worms - and the body's immune response.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Molecular Basis of Health and Disease III: Clinical Chemistry
description: Emphasis on normal human physiology and pathology as it related to clinical chemistry and assessment of disease states with the context of the Pharmacist Patient Care Process. Alterations of clinical chemistry results due to drug therapy are covered.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacology
description: Provides an overview of the basic principles of pharmacology, covering pharmacodynamics - effects of drugs on the body - and pharmacokinetics - the process by which a drug is absorbed, distributed, metabolized, and excreted by the body.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Public Health
description: Covers the framework, principles, and core responsibilities of public health research and practice from multidisciplinary perspectives. It also provides the necessary foundation for further studies using crosscutting approaches essential for public health practice.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Principles of Pharmacogenomics
description: Walks students through the basics of genetics and genomics. Particular emphasis is placed on the use of genetics or genetic testing to assist in patient treatment regimens and evaluation of disease.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmaceutical Biochemistry
description: Topics include the biological, chemical and cellular roles of carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, nucleic acids, hormones, enzymes and vitamins. In addition, the chemical and cellular basis of digestion, intermediary metabolism, biological oxidation and metabolic antagonism are discussed.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmacy Law and Ethics
description: An introduction to California and federal legal requirements that impact pharmacy practice, emphasizing the legal and ethical principles applied by pharmacists in their decision-making. Explores approaches for resolving ethical dilemmas in patient care.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Health Policy and Pharmacoeconomics
description: Introduces students to the organization, financing, and delivery of health care services in the U.S. The relationship of providers, patients, payers, etc., are analyzed. Management and research principles utilized to manage drug therapy are introduced.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Clinical Toxicology
description: Fundamentals of pharmacology and mechanisms of action are reinforced and applied to learn the clinical effects of acute/chronic exposure derived from environmental, dietary, occupational and pharmaceutical sources. Students focus on information literacy skills and clinical management of poisonings.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Medical Physiology with Anatomic Correlates
description: Concepts of physiology and mechanisms of body function at various levels of organization from cellular to organ systems. Emphasis on quantitative understanding of various body processes. Human anatomy is integrated with physiological concepts. Anatomic-physiologic relationships facilitated through virtual labs.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmaceutics I
description: The first in a foundational series designed to develop an understanding of the science behind drug formulation, mechanisms, pharmacokinetics and interconnections with the Pharmacist Patient Care Process.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmaceutics II
description: The second course in a foundational series designed to develop an understanding of the science behind drug formulation, mechanisms, pharmacokinetics and interconnections with the pharmacist patient care process. Topics include drug substances, dosage forms, and therapeutic effects. Includes laboratory.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Pharmaceutics III
description: The final course in a foundational series designed to develop an understanding of the science behind drug formulation, mechanisms, pharmacokinetics,and interconnections with the Pharmacist Patient Care Process. In laboratory, students perform pharmacokinetic modeling, drug screening, and comprehensive therapeutic efficacy.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Medicinal Chemistry I
description: Application of organic chemistry, biochemistry, molecular biology, physical chemistry, pharmacology, and physiology to understand the theory and mechanics of modern day medicinal chemistry. Topics include receptor-protein structure, dynamics, and interactions; drug development and design; and pharmacodynamics, and pharmacokinetics.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Medicinal Chemistry II
description: Walks students through medicinal chemistry, broadly defined. Students utilize the knowledge gained in organic chemistry, biochemistry, molecular biology, physical chemistry, pharmacology and physiology in an integrated fashion as applied to modern medicinal chemistry. Continuation of Medicinal Chemistry I.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Scholarly Project I
description: Provides students an opportunity to develop independent thinking, with particular focus on maturing analytical skills. Students are encouraged to develop an independent project, with a mentor, to study pharmacy-related aspects of multiple areas. First phase identifies project focus.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Scholarly Project II
description: Provides students an opportunity to develop independent thinking, with particular focus on maturing analytical skills. Students develop an independent project, with a mentor, to study pharmacy-related aspects of multiple areas. Phase 2 focuses on final evaluation of project.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Doctor of Pharmacy Epilogue
description: Reinforces and assesses student pharmacist's performance on cumulative learning outcomes; pre-APPE and APPE knowledge, skills, and attitudes; entrustable professional activities; team- and practice-readiness; and to demonstrate that student pharmacists are achieving outcomes required by the ACPE.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.

title: Research Seminar
description: Designed to engage students and expose them to seminar speakers that come to discuss research or case studies in pharmaceutical sciences and pharmacy.
restriction: Doctor of Pharmacy students have first consideration for enrollment. Graduate students only.
repeatability: May be repeated for credit unlimited times.
